page.syntax: Output_String as C = KEYLIST_BUILD(C keylist_format,C return_value,C column1[,C column2]...)

argument.name: keylist_format
argument.description: A comma delimited character string of format: Column_Number : Width [ Column_Heading ] For example: "1:30,2:20,3:15". In this example there are 3 columns of width 30, 20 and 15 respectively.

item.name: Column_Number
item.description: Type N. The sequence number of the column.

item.name: Width
item.description: Type N. The width of the column in characters.

item.name: Column_Heading
item.description: Type C. Optional. The column heading.

argument.name: return_value
argument.description: The name of the field to be returned when a record is selected.

argument.name: column1
argument.description: The names of the fields to display and Xdialog formatting information. The format is: Column1_expression, column2_expression, ? columnN_expression.

page.discussion: The KEYLIST_BUILD() function returns specially formatted data for display of advanced record lists in an Xdialog form. The syntax for an advanced record list-combo box control is: %K = Table, {Keylist_Expression}{Filter_Expression}%.Size VariableName where Keylist_Expression defines the order of the data in the record list and the columns in the record list. The Keylist_Expression uses KEYLIST_BUILD() to define:.

item.name: Order of data in the record list
How many columns are displayed in the record list
The value returned when the user makes a selection from the record list.

section.description: For more information, please refer to Learning Xdialog.

section.example: keylist_build('h=.025,1:15Lastname, 2:15Firstname, 3:20Address, 4:15City, 5:5St, 6:6Zip', lastname, lastname, firstname, address, city, state, zip)

section.description: Note : If you want to use a variable in a KEYLIST_BUILD() expression, because the KEYLIST_BUILD() function is embedded in an Xdialog definition, the resulting code must be structured like the following.
section.example: dim dialog_code as C dialog_code = <<%dlg% ...xdialog code... keylist_build(... %dlg% + variable + <<%dlg% ...) ...xdialog code... %dlg% ui_dlg_box("Title",dialog_code,<<%code% ...event handling code... %code%)
